name: chrissketch
text: Wouldn't the internet, in this analogy, be a baby's ass?

name: xiaomimi
text: It can produce nothing more substantial than a thin, coffee-like substance at this point, so the experience should not be too degrading for all of us.

name: morgulon
text: Wicked mad reference chubbies

name: dartigen
text:
I cannot stop chubbying this trifecta.
Assetbar give me more chubbies to give to this trifecta.

name: dtuba
text:
I'm not going to officially chubby this. Let it stand at 100 forever.

That, and my fuckin' OCD again.

name: carlyle
text: I'm a big fan of 101, so, sorry. Didn't mean to chubby you, either.

name: xiaomimi
text: I like 101 because it reminds me of Taipei 101, and then I can stretch the metaphor to imagine my post as a giant with an enormous ballsack and fireworks coming outta his face.

name: dtuba
text: Well, thanks for nothing, here's your chubby back.

name: carlyle
text: No, no, I insist. You keep it.

name: kochipoik
text: I think the baby's ass is us. So the diaper (the internet) gives us (the ass), 4chan (RASH).

name: baryonyx
text: TRY A SUMMERSAULT!

text: cock to a stranger

name: overmedicated
text: Goddamit, now I can't get a worms eye view of Ray's cabbages and cod out of my psyche.

name: jezebel
text: I live for these heart-warming avatar-comment synchronicities.

name: mr_pete
text: Ray can tap flow without movement. True Traceurs respect him for this.

name: twohundredninety
text: I cannot figure out why the subtitles make this so much funnier, but they do.

name: riazm
text: I enjoy the fact that the subtitle mentions Ray is standing.

name: unclejam
text: I guess it's so they know he's not the one in the car.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: that. poor. kitten.

name: epicurus
text:
I like to imagine the reactions of people watching this.

This strip also made me realize that Ray is a cat, so it is not so remarkable that he can jump about his own height veritcally with a complete flip.

name: whuppins
text: Achewood was ahead of the curve on making fun of parkour.

name: spinynorman
text:
This makes me think of the Top Gear episode where James was going to race his car against "two young men in silly trousers."

It was edited to be all cool and shit and have him lose, but James is just funny.

name: ruzkin
text:
Actually, just to clarify, this strip was a tribute to long-time Achewood fan Hamish "Wa5ter" Malcolm, who suffered something akin to a stroke while training Parkour in Melbourne with his friends. He was taken off life support on October 26, 2005.

Just so's you know.

name: greenkoolayd
text: pics or it didnt happen.

name: ruzkin
text: http://www.parkour.asn.au/hamish.php

text: thats hardcore AND sad.

text: it looks like teodor is looking at the picture-in-picture ray.  nice

name: riazm
text: Someone needs to make themselves some icons out of picture in picture Ray.

name: the_doz
text: The one with the question marks is particularly rad. Very "Wha- happened?"-esque.

name: sandswipe
text: I forgot to flip it so he's looking at the text, but it serves for now.

name: skyliner
text: Alt Text: The great thing about Parkour is that if you break your ankle, he sends you five dollars and a framed 8x10 of the word ACHIEVE.

name: brinstar
text: Who's "he"?

name: relaxing
text: Mr. Parkour, of course.

name: heavymetaljesus
text: Tightest grounding ever.

name: nicolae
text: Hard...core

name: nagsworth
text: Anyone have any idea why this is subtitled? Just a random idea or something more?

name: epicurus
text: Originally I thought it was supposed to be subtitling on the news broadcast, but with the camera pointed at the ground that wouldn't be possible. So it's probably a combination of a random idea and an effort to enhance the humour.

name: folby
text: I always took it as part of the "Achewood as a movie" thing, as seen in the strip where Phillipe's mom beats him and the strip with outtakes.

name: epicurus
text: Fort possible.

name: tekende
text: But that was a guest strip, and a terrible one at that. I wouldn't consider it canon.

name: achilleselbow
text: That was a guest strip though...

name: atticusonline
text: but that was a guest strip...

name: echidnaboy
text: But wasn't that a guest strip though?

name: xiaomimi
text: I always figured that the combination of typically lengthy dialogue and atypically action-heavy framing just raised too many word-balloon-placement issues, and Onstad said fuck it and went with subtitles.

name: achilleselbow
text: I thought it was because Ray damaged the camera in the previous strip and this is what is being shown on the newscast. But then I guess they would be saying 'viewers' instead of 'readers'.

name: presterjohn
text: 'sport-philosophy where the urban landscape is treated as an obstacle course' ... which explains why Teodor is practicing in the woods by a lake.

name: odei
text: Maybe he was just going for a jog and then he spotted some uban environment in the form of a car by a lake.

name: relaxing
text: BEAR AND KITTEN ICON!!!

name: lumus
text: He doesn't seem remotely surprised to meet Ray and Little Nephew out here. I choose to believe that he saw Ray on the webcam's feed on the news and came out here at a dead sprint to tell him about Parkour.

name: dumbeast
text: He didn't sprint.  He straight-up Parkour'd all the way.  Quickly, though.

name: inspectorgadget
text: Check out tiny Teodor in the distance in panel 3.

name: apricotta
text: Great eye. Chubby to you, sir.

name: gmm
text: Possibly the most perfectly titled strip ever. [Or at this point in the archives anyway, I have a lot of catching up still ahead of me]

name: xiaomimi
text:
Weekend Blogs

Roast Beef: Man this time I got dragged to the yarn store

I like how Roast Beef refers to knitting patterns as "code," indicating his one fleeting point of contact with the Boring world of the yarn store. Man you know bitches had the basics of programming completely figured out centuries before Charles Babbage looked at a loom and was like oh hey WHAT.

name: echidnaboy
text: "You get used to it. I don't even see the code. All I see is knit 1, purl 2..."

name: splendorr
text: Knit 1, Perl 2.0

name: buttermoths
text: Achieving 100% in 'Assassin's Creed' unlocks a secret mode where you play as Teodor in his Parkour outfit! Spread the word!

name: foetus_punch
text:
How about spinning? That's a good trick!

This is the second time I've referenced a bad film on achewood. A trend begins to form.

name: ravindra108
text: Looks like now it's Roast Beef's turn. They never did settle this issue .

name: malpt
text: Did anyone else notice Ray's bellybutton and sac in panel 12?

name: ham_shoes
text: Why does this remind me of Run Lola Run

name: fineoakstructure
text:
"A new sport-philosophy where the urban landscape is treated as an obstacle course."

Huh. That doesn't sound so new; it just sounds like skateboarding (just without the board).

name: icecube
text: Exactly man, exactly. The only difference with doing parkour is you are probably 30 and have a ponytail

name: cpnglxynchos
text: one of my friends a year or two younger than me picked up freerunning. it's pretty cool. i wish i was a bit lighter and more fit so i could do it.

name: icecube
text:
"My OLD MAN does parkour, you son of a bitch" (etc)

Seriously though Cpnglxynchos if you wish you could do it you pretty much just could. Free Running's strength is accessibility and immediacy - simply find a wall and try to scramble up it, then jump down again into a shock absorbing commando roll. Instant rush, free to try, not much fitness required.

Assuming one is prepared to put aside the obvious risk of injury/death, it is left with two main weaknesses:
1. Delusions of higher purpose. These people have conceived of themselves as the Good Guys, and they have all these pseduo-philosophical justifications for why what they do is important . Isn't it enough that it just looks cool?
2. The bizarre public spectacle it makes of people. With no skateboard or other accessory to explain their behaviour they make easy targets for ridicule.

Other than that though, it really does look cool and I wish the whole scene good luck

name: fineoakstructure
text: How things have changed in 20 years.  It used to be that having a skateboard might make you an easy target for ridicule.

name: splendorr
text:
No, I saw a couple of kids on skateboards outside a diner a few day ago, and everyone inside attributed ridicule to them. Perhaps undeserved, but their stupid hats and blankly mischievious expressions didn't help their case.

Stick a Chupa Chup in it why don't you, you roller derby abandonment babies,
Said everyone in the diner.

name: dasilodavi
text: I like when I go through the archives again and see an old strip that has new meaning in the contemporary scene.  At this point, Parkour has become a household word thanks to Mirror's edge.  This scene would've been nice to have in the game.  Then again, ANYTHING would have been nice to add to that 6 hour tech demo.

name: carlyle
text:
Teodor, this isn't the surburbs.

This is an unnamed beach.

name: genequagmire
text: Ah, the twist car jump to groundie.  Very rarely seen accomplished.

name: lolsworth
text: Ray's just taking "what in the hell" for a walk here.

name: fedallah
text:
I'm surprised no one mentioned [url="http://achewood.com/index.php?date=02042004"]this strip[/url].

...the most experimental moves, the rawest beats...
